logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: An ideal city

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Leonardo da Vinci’s ideal city was centuries ahead of its time

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đi trước thời đại hàng thế kỷ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be far more advanced or modern than other things of its period.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đi trước thời đại hàng thế kỷ

phase3Production.content: The author's ideas on space travel were centuries ahead of her time.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A true Renaissance man, he embodied scientific spirit, artistic talent and humanist sensibilities.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Người thời Phục hưng (người có nhiều tài năng)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person with many talents or areas of knowledge.

phase3Production.content: With his skills in music, painting, and science, he was a true Renaissance man.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A true Renaissance man, he embodied scientific spirit, artistic talent and humanist sensibilities.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be a tangible or visible form of an idea, quality, or feeling.

phase3Production.content: The national flag embodied the spirit of freedom and unity for the people.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A true Renaissance man, he embodied scientific spirit, artistic talent and humanist sensibilities.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An outlook or system of thought attaching prime importance to human rather than divine or supernatural matters, reflected in one's feelings and perceptions.

phase3Production.content: Her poetry is known for its deep humanist sensibilities and focus on the human condition.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Yet far from fading into insignificance, his thinking has carried down the centuries and still surprises today.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mờ nhạt đi và trở nên không quan trọng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Gradually becoming less important or noticeable until it is forgotten.

phase3Production.content: Many silent film stars began fading into insignificance with the advent of movies with sound.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The Renaissance marked the transition from the 15th century to modernity and took place after the spread of the plague in the 14th century...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đánh dấu sự chuyển đổi từ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be a sign or symbol of the change from one state or condition to another.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đánh dấu sự chuyển đổi từ

phase3Production.content: The fall of the Berlin Wall marked the transition from a divided Europe to a more unified one.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Today, the world is on the cusp of a climate crisis, which is predicted to cause widespread displacement, extinctions and death, if left unaddressed.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: At the point when something is about to change to something else; on the verge of.

phase3Production.content: The company is on the cusp of a major technological breakthrough.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which is predicted to cause widespread displacement, extinctions and death, if left unaddressed.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: If a problem or issue is not dealt with or ignored.

phase3Production.content: This minor crack in the foundation could cause major problems if left unaddressed.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Then, as now, radical solutions were called for to revolutionise the way people lived and safeguard humanity against catastrophe.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các giải pháp triệt để đã được yêu cầu

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: There was a demand for new and completely different methods to solve a problem.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cần có các giải pháp triệt để

phase3Production.content: After the financial crash, radical solutions were called for to reform the banking system.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and safeguard humanity against catastrophe.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bảo vệ nhân loại khỏi thảm họa

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To protect the human race from a large-scale disaster.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bảo vệ nhân loại khỏi thảm họa

phase3Production.content: International cooperation is needed to safeguard humanity against the threat of nuclear war.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Around 1486 – after a pestilence that killed half the population in Milan, Italy – Leonardo turned his thoughts to urban planning problems.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A fatal epidemic disease, especially bubonic plague.

phase3Production.content: In the Middle Ages, pestilence swept through Europe, causing millions of deaths.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Given that unsustainable urban models are a key cause of global climate change today, it’s only natural to wonder how Leonardo might have changed the shape of modern cities.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các mô hình đô thị không bền vững

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Ways of designing and running cities that cannot be continued at the same rate without causing severe environmental or social problems.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các mô hình đô thị không bền vững

phase3Production.content: Many experts argue that our reliance on cars creates unsustainable urban models.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although the Renaissance is renowned as an era of incredible progress in art and architecture...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nổi tiếng là một kỷ nguyên của

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be famous and respected for being a period of a particular quality or achievement.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nổi tiếng là một kỷ nguyên của

phase3Production.content: The Victorian period is renowned as an era of industrial innovation and social change.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it is rarely noted that the 15th century also marked the birth of urbanism as a true academic discipline.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự ra đời của chủ nghĩa đô thị

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The beginning of the study of the characteristic way of life of city dwellers and the development and planning of cities.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự ra đời của chủ nghĩa đô thị

phase3Production.content: The industrial revolution spurred the birth of urbanism as cities grew at an unprecedented rate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The rigour and method behind the conscious conception of a city had been largely missing in Western thought...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự chặt chẽ và phương pháp

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being extremely thorough, exact, and careful, combined with a systematic procedure.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự chặt chẽ và phương pháp

phase3Production.content: Scientific research requires a great deal of rigour and method to produce reliable results.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The rigour and method behind the conscious conception of a city had been largely missing in Western thought...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Quan niệm có ý thức về một thành phố

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The deliberate and intentional planning and design of a city as a whole entity.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Quan niệm có ý thức về một thành phố

phase3Production.content: The plan for the new capital was a conscious conception of a city built in harmony with nature.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...until the moment when prominent Renaissance men pushed forward large-scale urban projects in Italy...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những người đàn ông nổi bật thời Phục hưng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Important and famous multi-talented individuals from the Renaissance period.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những nhân vật nổi bật thời Phục hưng

phase3Production.content: Michelangelo and Leonardo da Vinci are two of the most prominent Renaissance men.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...such as the reconfiguration of the town of Pienza and the expansion of the city of Ferrara.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The action of arranging something in a different way; altering the shape or structure of something.

phase3Production.content: The office is closed for a week for a complete reconfiguration of the workspace.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: These works surely inspired Leonardo’s decision to rethink the design of medieval cities, with their winding and overcrowded streets and with houses piled against one another.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các thành phố thời trung cổ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Cities that developed during the Middle Ages, often characterized by narrow, irregular streets, defensive walls, and dense construction.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các thành phố thời trung cổ

phase3Production.content: Many European medieval cities have preserved their historic centers and ancient walls.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with their winding and overcrowded streets and with houses piled against one another.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những con đường quanh co và quá đông đúc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Roads that are not straight and are filled with too many people or things.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những con đường quanh co và quá đông đúc

phase3Production.content: The old quarter of the city is famous for its charming but winding and overcrowded streets.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It is not easy to identify a coordinated vision of Leonardo’s ideal city because of his disordered way of working with notes and sketches.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tầm nhìn phối hợp, thống nhất

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A single, unified plan or idea that has been carefully organized.

phase3Production.content: The project failed due to the lack of a coordinated vision among the team leaders.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...because of his disordered way of working with notes and sketches.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A chaotic and unsystematic method of performing tasks.

phase3Production.content: Despite his disordered way of working, the artist produced masterpieces.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But from the largest collection of Leonardo’s papers ever assembled, a series of innovative thoughts can be reconstructed regarding the foundation of a new city...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: New, original, and advanced ideas.

phase3Production.content: The company encourages innovative thoughts from all its employees.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a series of innovative thoughts can be reconstructed regarding the foundation of a new city along the Ticino River...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To build or form something again after it has been damaged or destroyed; to form an impression or model of something from the available evidence.

phase3Production.content: Based on the fossil fragments, scientists have reconstructed what the dinosaur might have looked like.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and he wanted a comfortable and spacious city, with well-ordered streets and architecture.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A city with a lot of room and open space.

phase3Production.content: The new development plan aims to create a more spacious city with plenty of parks and green areas.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with well-ordered streets and architecture.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những con đường được sắp xếp tốt

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Streets that are arranged in a neat, tidy, and logical way, such as a grid pattern.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những con đường được sắp xếp trật tự

phase3Production.content: The city is known for its well-ordered streets and clean public spaces.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He recommended ‘high, strong walls’, with ‘towers and battlements of all necessary and pleasant beauty’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Tall, narrow structures and the upper part of a castle wall with openings for shooting through.

phase3Production.content: From the towers and battlements of the ancient castle, soldiers could defend against attackers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: His plans for a modern and ‘rational’ city were consistent with Renaissance ideals.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In agreement with; not contradicting.

phase3Production.content: The court's decision was consistent with previous rulings on similar cases.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But, in keeping with his personality, Leonardo included several innovations in his urban design.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In harmony or conformity with.

phase3Production.content: The new building was designed in keeping with the historical character of the neighborhood.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Leonardo wanted the city to be built on several levels, linked with vertical outdoor staircases.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cầu thang bộ ngoài trời theo chiều dọc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Stairs on the exterior of a building that go straight up, connecting different floors.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cầu thang bộ ngoài trời theo chiều dọc

phase3Production.content: The apartment building had a series of vertical outdoor staircases at the back for emergency access.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This design can be seen in some of today’s high-rise buildings but was unconventional at the time.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Tall modern buildings with many floors.

phase3Production.content: Many modern cities are dominated by high-rise buildings that serve as offices and apartments.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...but was unconventional at the time.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không theo quy ước vào thời điểm đó

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not based on or conforming to what is generally done or believed during that period.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Độc đáo vào thời điểm đó

phase3Production.content: Her style of painting was considered very unconventional at the time, but she is now seen as a pioneer.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Indeed, this idea of taking full advantage of the interior spaces wasn’t implemented until the 1920s and 1930s...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make the best use of an opportunity or available resource.

phase3Production.content: She is taking full advantage of her time abroad to learn a new language.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with the birth of the Modernist movement.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A philosophical and artistic movement in the late 19th and early 20th centuries that fostered a period of experimentation in the arts, architecture, and literature.

phase3Production.content: The architect was heavily influenced by the clean lines and functional design of the Modernist movement.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: While in the upper layers of the city, people could walk undisturbed between elegant palaces and streets...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đi lại mà không bị làm phiền

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To move around on foot without being interrupted or bothered.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đi lại mà không bị làm phiền

phase3Production.content: He found a quiet corner of the library where he could read undisturbed for hours.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...people could walk undisturbed between elegant palaces and streets...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Graceful and stylishly beautiful large residences, especially of a sovereign or bishop.

phase3Production.content: The city is famous for its beautiful architecture and elegant palaces.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But the true originality of Leonardo’s vision was its fusion of architecture and engineering.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự kết hợp giữa kiến trúc và kỹ thuật

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process or result of joining the art of designing buildings and the science of building structures.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự kết hợp giữa kiến trúc và kỹ thuật

phase3Production.content: The Sydney Opera House is a brilliant example of the fusion of architecture and engineering.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Leonardo designed extensive hydraulic plants to create artificial canals throughout the city.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các nhà máy thủy lực lớn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Large-scale systems involving the movement and control of water.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các hệ thống thủy lực lớn

phase3Production.content: The ancient Romans built extensive hydraulic plants, including aqueducts, to supply their cities with water.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The canals, regulated by clocks and basins, were supposed to make it easier for boats to navigate inland.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được điều chỉnh bởi đồng hồ và bể chứa

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Controlled by time-keeping devices and water-holding reservoirs.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được điều chỉnh bởi đồng hồ và bể chứa

phase3Production.content: The flow of water through the canal system was precisely regulated by clocks and basins.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...were supposed to make it easier for boats to navigate inland.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To find a route and travel on water away from the coast and into the interior of a country.

phase3Production.content: The new canal system allowed large ships to navigate inland for the first time.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that the width of the streets ought to match the average height of the adjacent houses...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Houses that are next to or adjoining something else.

phase3Production.content: A fire in one building quickly spread to the adjacent houses.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: reduce the risk of damage from earthquakes
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to allow access to sun and reduce the risk of damage from earthquakes.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Giảm nguy cơ thiệt hại do động đất

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /rɪˈdjuːs ðə rɪsk əv ˈdæmɪdʒ frəm ˈɜːθkweɪks/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To lessen the possibility of harm or destruction caused by seismic events.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giảm nguy cơ thiệt hại do động đất

phase3Production.content: New building codes were introduced to reduce the risk of damage from earthquakes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although some of these features existed in Roman cities, before Leonardo’s drawings there had never been a multi-level, compact modern city which was thoroughly technically conceived.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được hình thành một cách kỹ thuật toàn diện

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be planned or designed with complete and careful attention to technical details.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được hình thành một cách kỹ thuật toàn diện

phase3Production.content: The space station was a thoroughly technically conceived project that took decades to complete.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: subdivision of the city by function
lexicalItems.sourceContext: For example, the subdivision of the city by function – with services and infrastructures located in the lower levels and wide and well-ventilated boulevards and walkways above for residents...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự phân chia thành phố theo chức năng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The division of a city into different zones or areas, each with a specific purpose (e.g., residential, commercial, industrial).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự phân chia thành phố theo chức năng

phase3Production.content: Modern urban planning often involves the subdivision of the city by function to improve efficiency and quality of life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and wide and well-ventilated boulevards and walkways above for residents...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Broad streets, often with trees and greenery, that have a good supply of fresh air.

phase3Production.content: The city's design features wide, well-ventilated boulevards to combat the summer heat.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is an idea that can be found in Georges-Eugène Haussmann’s renovation of Paris under Emperor Napoleon III between 1853 and 1870.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The large-scale rebuilding and modernization of Paris in the 19th century.

phase3Production.content: Haussmann's renovation of Paris created the wide avenues and grand buildings that the city is famous for today.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Today, Leonardo’s ideas are not simply valid, they actually suggest a way forward for urban planning.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Gợi ý một hướng đi cho

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To propose a course of action or a path for future progress.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Gợi ý một hướng đi cho

phase3Production.content: The report's conclusions suggest a way forward for improving public transportation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Many scholars think that the compact city, built upwards instead of outwards, integrated with nature (especially water systems), with efficient transport infrastructure, could help modern cities become more efficient and sustainable.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An urban planning concept that promotes relatively high residential density with mixed land uses, based on an efficient public transport system.

phase3Production.content: The concept of the compact city is seen as a solution to urban sprawl and traffic congestion.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the compact city, built upwards instead of outwards...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Xây dựng theo chiều cao thay vì chiều rộng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Constructing taller buildings to increase density, rather than expanding the city's area horizontally.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xây dựng theo chiều cao thay vì chiều rộng

phase3Production.content: To preserve surrounding green spaces, the city decided to encourage new developments to be built upwards instead of outwards.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...integrated with nature (especially water systems)...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Combined with the natural world in a way that makes them part of a whole.

phase3Production.content: The new eco-resort is beautifully integrated with nature, using local materials and preserving existing trees.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with efficient transport infrastructure, could help modern cities become more efficient and sustainable.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hạ tầng giao thông hiệu quả

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The basic physical systems of a city, such as transportation, that allow it to operate in a productive way with minimum wasted effort.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hạ tầng giao thông hiệu quả

phase3Production.content: Investing in an efficient transport infrastructure is key to reducing traffic congestion and pollution.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is yet another reason why Leonardo was aligned so closely with modern urban planning and centuries ahead of his time.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be in a position of agreement or alliance with something to a great degree.

phase3Production.content: Her personal values are aligned so closely with the company's mission statement.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The word ‘genius’ is universally associated with the name of Leonardo da Vinci.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được liên kết phổ biến với

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be connected in people's minds with something all over the world.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được liên kết phổ biến với

phase3Production.content: The color red is universally associated with danger or a warning.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...his thinking has carried down the centuries and still surprises today.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được lưu truyền qua nhiều thế kỷ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have been transmitted or passed on through many hundreds of years.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được lưu truyền qua nhiều thế kỷ

phase3Production.content: The traditional folk songs have been carried down the centuries by word of mouth.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and took place after the spread of the plague in the 14th century...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự lây lan của bệnh dịch hạch

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The expansion of the contagious bacterial disease, especially the Black Death.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự lây lan của bệnh dịch hạch

phase3Production.content: The spread of the plague was facilitated by poor sanitation in medieval cities.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which caused a global crisis resulting in some 200 million deaths across Europe and Asia.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A time of intense difficulty, trouble, or danger affecting the entire world.

phase3Production.content: The COVID-19 pandemic triggered a global crisis in public health and the economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Leonardo turned his thoughts to urban planning problems.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chuyển suy nghĩ của mình sang

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To begin to think about or consider a particular subject.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chuyển suy nghĩ của mình sang

phase3Production.content: After finishing his novel, the author turned his thoughts to writing a screenplay.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...marked the birth of urbanism as a true academic discipline.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A branch of knowledge that is taught and researched as part of higher education.

phase3Production.content: Sociology is a fascinating academic discipline that studies human social behavior.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The rigour and method behind the conscious conception of a city had been largely missing in Western thought...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Mostly absent from or not present in something.

phase3Production.content: A key ingredient was largely missing from the recipe, which is why the cake tasted strange.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with houses piled against one another.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Built very closely together in a disorderly heap.

phase3Production.content: In the crowded slum, small shacks were piled against one another.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But from the largest collection of Leonardo’s papers ever assembled, a series of innovative thoughts can be reconstructed...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các tài liệu từng được tập hợp

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The most comprehensive collection of documents that has ever been gathered together.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các tài liệu từng được tập hợp

phase3Production.content: The museum is exhibiting the largest collection of the artist's drawings ever assembled.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Indeed, this idea of taking full advantage of the interior spaces wasn’t implemented until the 1920s and 1930s...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To put a decision, plan, or agreement into effect.

phase3Production.content: The new safety regulations will be implemented starting next month.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But the true originality of Leonardo’s vision was its fusion of architecture and engineering.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The genuine quality of being novel, creative, and not derived from something else.

phase3Production.content: The true originality of her work lies in its unique blend of different musical styles.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Although some of these features existed in Roman cities, before Leonardo’s drawings there had never been a multi-level, compact modern city...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Cities built during the time of the Roman Empire, often characterized by a grid layout, forums, aqueducts, and public baths.

phase3Production.content: The ruins of ancient Roman cities can be found throughout the Mediterranean.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Today, Leonardo’s ideas are not simply valid, they actually suggest a way forward for urban planning.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không chỉ đơn thuần là hợp lệ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not just sound, just, or well-founded; having a greater significance.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không chỉ đơn thuần là hợp lệ

phase3Production.content: Her argument is not simply valid; it is a groundbreaking new perspective on the issue.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is yet another reason why Leonardo was aligned so closely with modern urban planning...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: One more reason in a series of reasons.

phase3Production.content: He's smart, he's funny, and he's kind. That's yet another reason why I like him.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A true Renaissance man, he embodied scientific spirit, artistic talent and humanist sensibilities.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An attitude of inquiry, curiosity, and reliance on evidence and logical reasoning.

phase3Production.content: The project was conducted with a true scientific spirit, questioning every assumption.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A true Renaissance man, he embodied scientific spirit, artistic talent and humanist sensibilities.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A natural aptitude or skill in the arts, such as painting, music, or sculpture.

phase3Production.content: From a young age, she showed a remarkable artistic talent.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...radical solutions were called for to revolutionise the way people lived...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To change something radically or fundamentally.

phase3Production.content: The invention of the internet would revolutionise communication.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Leonardo turned his thoughts to urban planning problems.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các vấn đề quy hoạch đô thị

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Difficulties and challenges related to the design and management of cities and towns.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các vấn đề quy hoạch đô thị

phase3Production.content: Traffic congestion is one of the most common urban planning problems in large cities.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Following a typical Renaissance trend, he began to work on an ‘ideal city’ project – due to its excessive costs – would remain unfulfilled.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An amount of money needed for a purpose that is more than is necessary, normal, or desirable.

phase3Production.content: The project was cancelled due to its excessive costs and lack of funding.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...due to its excessive costs – would remain unfulfilled.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To continue to be not carried out or brought to completion.

phase3Production.content: Many of his childhood dreams would unfortunately remain unfulfilled.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...prominent Renaissance men pushed forward large-scale urban projects in Italy...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các dự án đô thị quy mô lớn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Major construction or redevelopment initiatives covering a large area of a city.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các dự án đô thị quy mô lớn

phase3Production.content: The city is undertaking several large-scale urban projects to improve its infrastructure.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: These works surely inspired Leonardo’s decision to rethink the design of medieval cities...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Suy nghĩ lại về thiết kế

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To think again about a plan, idea, or system in order to change or improve it.
